Text: PESHAWAR: The Bureau of Statistics (BoS) with technical assistance from German Development Cooperation (GIZ) on Thursday launched the User Satisfaction Survey. The BoS has posted questionnaires to different user groups and has also developed and launched an online version of the survey questionnaire to make it accessible and easy to fill in for potential respondents, said a communiqué. The user groups include various provincial government departments, organisations in the province and other provinces including federal government organisations and academia, it added. The purpose of this exercise is to determine the data users’ satisfaction with regards to the BoS publications besides ascertaining the need for additional information and gaps being identified by the respondents. Tariq Mehmood, director BoS, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, said that the bureau is an integral part of the Planning and Development Department (P&DD), of the government as it provides data on various socio-economic, infrastructure and commodities producing sectors of the province to meet the planning needs of the policy makers.
